metadata.Title: CVE-2015-6824 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
The sws_init_context function in libswscale/utils.c in FFmpeg before 2.7.2does not initialize certain pixbuf data structures, which allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation violation) or possiblyhave unspecified other impact via crafted video data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6824` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.3-1
libav-tools - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavdevice57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter6 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavformat57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavresample3 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavutil55 - 7:2.8.3-1
libpostproc54 - 7:2.8.3-1
libswresample2 - 7:2.8.3-1
libswscale4 - 7:2.8.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.3-1').
